skill.name: scikit-bio
skill.description: Biological data toolkit. Sequence analysis, alignments, phylogenetic trees, diversity metrics (alpha/beta, UniFrac), ordination (PCoA), PERMANOVA, FASTA/Newick I/O, for microbiome analysis.
skill.summary: Biological data toolkit. Sequence analysis, alignments, phylogenetic trees, diversity metrics (alpha...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill with no executable code. All 133 static findings are false positives: detected backticks are markdown code delimiters, C2 keywords are scientific abbreviations (PC1, CCA, RDA for ordination methods), weak crypto flags are biological substitution matrices (BLOSUM62 for protein alignments), and URLs are official documentation links. No command injection, network exfiltration, or malicious patterns exist.

content.value_statement: Process biological sequences, calculate diversity metrics, and perform statistical tests on microbiome and ecological data. This skill provides comprehensive guidance for bioinformatics workflows including sequence alignment, phylogenetic analysis, and ordination.
actual_capabilities: Read and write biological file formats including FASTA, FASTQ, GenBank, Newick, and BIOM
Perform sequence alignments using Needleman-Wunsch, Smith-Waterman, and SSW algorithms
Construct and manipulate phylogenetic trees with Neighbor Joining, UPGMA, and tree distance metrics
Calculate alpha and beta diversity metrics including Shannon, Simpson, Bray-Curtis, and UniFrac
Run ordination methods (PCoA, CCA, RDA) for dimensional reduction and visualization
Perform statistical tests including PERMANOVA, ANOSIM, Mantel test, and PERMDISP
limitations: Does not provide pre-computed biological datasets - users must provide their own data
Does not generate publication-quality visualizations - requires integration with matplotlib or seaborn
Does not include machine learning models for sequence classification - works with protein embeddings from external models

use_cases.title: Analyze microbiome diversity
use_cases.description: Calculate alpha and beta diversity from OTU tables and perform PERMANOVA testing on sample groupings.

use_cases.title: Build phylogenetic trees
use_cases.description: Construct trees from sequence alignments and calculate Robinson-Foulds distances for tree comparison.

use_cases.title: Process sequence data
use_cases.description: Read, filter, and transform biological sequences across 19+ file formats with validation.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Sequence Operations
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to read a FASTA file with skbio, calculate reverse complement, and find motifs using regex patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Diversity Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Guide me through calculating Shannon alpha diversity from a counts matrix and computing Bray-Curtis beta diversity between samples.

prompt_templates.title: Phylogenetic Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me build a phylogenetic tree using Neighbor Joining from a distance matrix and calculate patristic distances between taxa.

prompt_templates.title: Statistical Testing
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to run a PERMANOVA test on a distance matrix to determine if sample groups differ significantly, with 999 permutations.

output_examples.input: Calculate diversity metrics from my OTU table
output: Calculate alpha diversity: alpha_diversity('shannon', counts, ids=sample_ids)
Calculate beta diversity: beta_diversity('braycurtis', counts, ids=sample_ids)

output_examples.input: Build a phylogenetic tree from my sequences
output: Calculate distance matrix: seq1.distance(seq2) or use kmer_distance

best_practices: Use generators (skbio.io.read) for large sequence files to avoid memory issues
Integrate with pandas and numpy for downstream analysis and visualization
Validate sequence IDs match across files before diversity calculations
anti_patterns: Do not use relative frequencies for counts - convert to integers first
Do not mix rooted and unrooted trees when calculating Robinson-Foulds distances
Do not skip PERMDISP when running PERMANOVA - check dispersion assumptions

faq.question: What file formats does scikit-bio support?
faq.answer: FASTA, FASTQ, GenBank, EMBL, Clustal, PHYLIP, Stockholm, Newick, BIOM (HDF5/JSON), and delimited matrices.

faq.question: How do I calculate phylogenetic diversity?
faq.answer: Use alpha_diversity('faith_pd', counts, tree=tree, otu_ids=feature_ids) with a rooted phylogenetic tree.

faq.question: What is the difference between alpha and beta diversity?
faq.answer: Alpha measures within-sample diversity (e.g., Shannon, Simpson), beta measures between-sample dissimilarity (e.g., Bray-Curtis, UniFrac).

faq.question: Can I use scikit-bio with QIIME 2?
faq.answer: Yes, scikit-bio reads and writes QIIME 2 compatible formats including BIOM tables, trees, and distance matrices.

faq.question: How do I handle large sequence files efficiently?
faq.answer: Use generator-based reading: for seq in skbio.io.read('large.fasta', format='fasta', constructor=skbio.DNA)

faq.question: What statistical tests are available for ecological data?
faq.answer: PERMANOVA, ANOSIM, PERMDISP, Mantel test, and Bioenv for environmental variable selection.
